intro: Oxytheca inermis, commonly known as the smooth oxytheca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, cylindrical stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Oxytheca inermis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
